comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Auto Truck Chauffeurs Quit Without Warning, Demoralizing the Service. The entire mail transfer service in Manhattan, a service that handles on an average of 200,000 pounds of mail every hour, exclusive of the parcel post and purely local mail, was demoralized last night following a strike of the chauffeurs employed by the Postal Transfer Service, Incorporated, of 543 West Twenty-fifth Street, which has the contract for the mail transfer. Source: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9507E0DB133FE633A...

comment.author: 15283643@N04
comment._content: Lovely truck! Chain-and-sprocket drive; solid rubber tires; gold leaf monogram ("USM") and decorative striping; tufted leather upholstery; roll-up canvas or oilcloth weather curtains; oil side lamps.
